summary: An FBI email from September 2021 forwarding a single page of handwritten notes from an interview with housekeeper Sonam Dema conducted during the July 2019 search of Jeffrey Epstein's properties. The agent offers to create a formal FBI 302 report but suggests uploading the notes directly to the Sentinel system due to the time elapsed.

persons.name: Sonam Dema
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI during the July 2019 search of Jeffrey Epstein's properties. The document contains the agent's notes from that interview.

persons.name: Kelly
persons.context: Found the page of notes from the July 2019 interview with Sonam Dema.

events.title: Original Epstein property search and interview
events.description: FBI agents conducted a search of Jeffrey Epstein's properties and interviewed housekeeper Sonam Dema.

events.title: Discovery and forwarding of 2019 interview notes
events.description: An FBI agent emails colleagues about finding a page of handwritten notes from the July 2019 interview with housekeeper Sonam Dema, discussing whether to create a formal 302 report.

keyFacts: The FBI conducted an interview with housekeeper Sonam Dema during the July 2019 search of Jeffrey Epstein's properties.
The interview was documented in handwritten notes, but no formal FBI 302 report was created at the time.
The notes were rediscovered and forwarded via email in September 2021, over two years after the interview.
The agent suggests uploading the original notes to the Sentinel system rather than creating a belated formal report.
